title: Chomsky released at T26
content:
Chomsky is released by T26 today. This is my first commercial typeface, a fun typeface to play with, hence the great family price-cut. A mini site is scheduled to come real soon.  
 [http://www.t26.com/fonts/5886-Chomsky](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015110430/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/5886-Chomsky "http://www.t26.com/fonts/5886-Chomsky")

A PDF specimen is also available at my site:  
 [http://merdekaataoemati.com/downloads/chomsky\_specimen\_latest.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015110430/http:/merdekaataoemati.com/downloads/chomsky_specimen_latest.pdf "http://merdekaataoemati.com/downloads/chomsky\_specimen\_latest.pdf")

Cheers!

comments.content: I’m confused—what’s the difference between all the variations? The P22 site really doesn’t handle chromatic fonts well.

The non-regular weights are only supplemental, they're merely the regular weight with expanded contours. They're meant to be used as a background layer for the regular weight, as illustrated in [this image](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015110430/http:/www.t26.com/uploaded_files/0000/0058/Specimen_Image.png) (I know I should've uploaded a decent PDF specimen by now).

What do you mean about the P22 site?
Yes, I know what you mean. But, as I've described in [T26's page](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015110430/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/5886-Chomsky) they're never intended to be set in small size. :D
Err, I meant T26. My brain doesn’t handle short things well.

@James Puckett:  
Yes, it happen all the time with numbers. :D
